title: Bear Grylls - Born Survivor - Sumatra - [2008] - [H.264] [HD] -
description:
#############
# Movie Infomation #
#############

Join Bear on an adventure of a lifetime, in one of the most dangerous places on the planet..."The Ring Of Fire!"

Consistently hit with massive earthquakes and with 30 active volcanoes, as well as being the epicentre of the earthquake that caused the infamous 2004 tsunami, this is one of the most unstable environments on earth. Watch in awe as Bear heads deep into the heart of tiger territory, the Sumatran jungle, abseils down a treacherous waterfall, battles relentless downpours, hunts stingrays and builds a raft out of old driftwood in an attempt to make it off the desert island and back to civilization... all in the name of survival.

H264 - Is the way to where quality is concerned! - its the new KvCD - but better, in everyway.
H.264 is a next-generation video compression format. H.264 is also known as MPEG-4 AVC. 
Developed for use in high definition systems such as HDTV, Blu-ray and HD DVD as well as low resolution portable devices such as Sony's PSP and Apple's iPod.
Even DivX/XviD is no match for H.264 - H.264 can often be 30% smaller than DivX/XviD and still offer the same quality video.


Playback methods:

 There are several ways in which you can playback H.264 content. The methods covered are:

    * VideoLAN
    * ffdshow (Media Player Classic or Windows Media Player)
    * CoreAVC
    * Nero ShowTime
    * QuickTime
    * PowerDVD 
    * VLC Player

You will only need one of these methods to playback H.264 encoded video - the methods above have been listed in the order that you should attempt playback.
